32#ifndef _LINUX_MM_H_
33#define _LINUX_MM_H_
34
35#include <sys/malloc.h>
36
37#include <uvm/uvm_extern.h>
38
39#include <asm/page.h>
40#include <linux/shrinker.h>
41
42struct file;
43
44/* XXX Ugh bletch! Whattakludge! Linux's sense is reversed... */
45#undef PAGE_MASK
46#define PAGE_MASK (~(PAGE_SIZE-1))
47
48#define PAGE_ALIGN(x) (((x) + (PAGE_SIZE-1)) & ~(PAGE_SIZE-1))
49#define offset_in_page(x) ((x) & (PAGE_SIZE-1))
50
51struct sysinfo {
52 unsigned long totalram;
53 unsigned long totalhigh;
54 uint32_t mem_unit;
55};
56
57static inline void
58si_meminfo(struct sysinfo *si)
59{
60
61 si->totalram = uvmexp.npages;
62 si->totalhigh = kernel_map->size >> PAGE_SHIFT;
63 si->mem_unit = PAGE_SIZE;
64 /* XXX Fill in more as needed. */
65}
66
67static inline unsigned long
68vm_mmap(struct file *file __unused, unsigned long base __unused,
69 unsigned long size __unused, unsigned long prot __unused,
70 unsigned long flags __unused, unsigned long token __unused)
71{
72
73 return -ENODEV;
74}
75
76static inline unsigned long
77get_num_physpages(void)
78{
79 return uvmexp.npages;
80}
81
82/*
83 * XXX Requires that kmalloc in <linux/slab.h> and vmalloc in
84 * <linux/vmalloc.h> both use malloc(9). If you change either of
85 * those, be sure to update this.
86 */
87static inline void
88kvfree(void *ptr)
89{
90
91 if (ptr != NULL)
92 free(ptr, M_TEMP);
93}
94
95static inline void
96set_page_dirty(struct page *page)
97{
98
99 page->p_vmp.flags &= ~PG_CLEAN;
100}
101
102#endif /* _LINUX_MM_H_ */
103
